docs.snippet: Under the headline, "Kill the Carpetbagger," Slate put the Bagger through its Nexis spanking machine and decided he needs to spend all of his working life writing about issues of civic moment....
docs.lead_paragraph: Suggesting he should be writing more about Pakistan and foreclosure, Slate put the Bagger through its Nexis spanking machine and decided he needs to spend all of his working life writing about issues of civic moment. And man, that really hurts. It's as if the Bagger was back in high school and that really smart kid at the chalk board took time out from solving a difficult trig problem or creating a formula to end world hunger before suddenly turning around and beaning the Bagger with a chalk eraser:
docs.abstract: Under the headline, "Kill the Carpetbagger," Slate put the Bagger through its Nexis spanking machine and decided he needs to spend all of his working life writing about issues of civic moment.

headline.main: Slate to The Bagger: Drop Dead

docs.snippet: Gym rats and other exercisers are signing up for Bollywood-style dance classes....
docs.lead_paragraph: Bollywood-style dance classes, based on the lavish dance numbers found in some films from India, have become a popular attraction among American exercisers, the Associated Press reports.
docs.abstract: Gym rats and other exercisers are signing up for Bollywood-style dance classes.

docs.snippet: After making discreet inquiries to studios around town, the Baquette has discovered that the pre-Oscar party scene has been scaled way back this year. Yes, they are taking place to celebrate nominations, but they are smaller, some in the form of i...
docs.lead_paragraph: After making discreet inquiries to studios around town, the Baquette has discovered that the pre-Oscar party scene has been scaled way back this year. Yes, they are taking place, but they are smaller, some in the form of intimate dinners rather than gigantic parties poolside at some luxury hotel.
docs.abstract: After making discreet inquiries to studios around town, the Baquette has discovered that the pre-Oscar party scene has been scaled way back this year. Yes, they are taking place to celebrate nominations, but they are smaller, some in the form of intimate dinners rather than gigaantic parties poolside at some luxury hotel.

docs.snippet: Much has been written about the lack of box office this year's nominees have generated, turning the so-called Oscar bump into a bit of a pothole. But according to Bloomberg News, "Slumdog Millionaire" has been surprisingly buoyant since being name...
docs.lead_paragraph: Much has been written about the lack of box office this year's nominees have generated, turning the so-called Oscar bump into a bit of a pothole. But according to Bloomberg News, "Slumdog Millionaire" has been surprisingly buoyant since being named and may end up topping $100 million:
docs.abstract: Much has been written about the lack of box office this year's nominees have generated, turning the so-called Oscar bump into a bit of a pothole. But according to Bloomberg News, "Slumdog Millionaire" has been surprisingly buoyant since being named and may end up topping $100 million.

headline.main: The Bagger in L.A.: My, What a Nice Oscar Bump You Have, Mrs. Slumdog
